page.title: 04Henbury House
page.content: Built in the reign of{George III, in the second half of the 18th century, this house has in the last five years been{rescued from {deriliction.}There are twelve acres of gardens and parkland with some fine lime trees, and a large{walled garden. The plan was to transform the house into a{hotel and restaurant}and the Old Kitchens opened as a restaurant under that name. This was forced to close due to financial difficulties and the house has been sold. The new owners hope to turn the range of buildings around the courtyard into a number of{holiday cottages}and to build a{leisure centre}with swimming pool and tennis courts. This house is off the main A31 Wimborne to Bere Regis road just east of Roundhouse Roundabout.
